RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduado em Engenharia Agronmica pela Universidade Federal de Viosa (2012), especializao (2010-2011) em Geoprocessamento no RMRS - US Forest Service ? USDA e mestrado em Sensoriamento Remoto pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (PGSER/INPE, 2014). Atualmente doutorando em Sensoriamento Remoto no Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (PGSER/INPE). Tem atuao principalmente nas seguintes reas: Geomorfometria, Geoestatstica, Processamento Digital de Imagens, Hidrologia, Solos e Uso e Cobertura da Terra.

ESPECIALIZACAO.TITULO-DA-MONOGRAFIA: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height with Lidar data

MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Correo radiomtrica do efeito de iluminao solar induzido pela topografia

DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Ncleo de Estudo de Planejamento do Uso da Terra
United State Department of Agriculture USDA

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A large portion of LiDAR acquisition cost is incurred during post-processing to separate ground from non-ground returns. This is in large part due to the manual editing required to "clean up" the surface and the need to reclaim software development or purchase costs. LiDAR vendors have put forth substantial investment into development of ground identification algorithms. Unfortunately, the majority of available algorithms are proprietary and available only in commercial software or through "in-house" vendor processing at considerable cost. Ground information is often delivered in the form of gridded raster or normally spaced point data. Both of these deliverables generalize the data, discarding the original spatial precision and volume of ground returns. The original volume of ground returns is needed to build relationships between ground and vegetation returns. If an appropriate volume of ground returns is retained, then the resulting interpolated surface will match the scale and precision of the original LiDAR point cloud, reducing bias and error in the derived heights. A simple differencing of the interpolated ground height surface from the raw LiDAR elevations will provide the vegetation height at each point while preserving density relationships related to vegetation cover, such as the proportion of non-ground to ground returns.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height with Lidar data
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Light Detection Ranging (LiDAR) has emerged as a promising technology in many disciplines, including geology, forestry, and hydrology. Despite a growing body of LiDAR literature, gaps in information on issues related to acquisition and processing of LiDAR data still exist. In recent years, various efforts have been made, at state level and beyond, for web-based distribution of raw LiDAR data (e.g. OpenTopography, CLICK) as well as LiDAR-derived products (e.g. INSIDE Idaho). However, proper processing of raw data, and documenting the processing steps in a standard-compliant metadata are essential before LiDAR data and value-added products can be made available to the public domain through data portals... (http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0003, http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0002, http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0001)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height with Lidar data

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Monitoramento e anlise do comportamento hidrolgico da bacia hidrogrfica antes e aps a aplicao de tcnicas de conservao do solo e gua..

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de Minas Gerais

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelagem digital do terreno aplicado a estudos do meio fsico
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A recente disponibilidade de modelos digitais de elevao (MDE) de ampla cobertura tem demandado um intenso esforo de adaptao de tcnicas at ento manuais para processos em sistemas de informao geogrfica (SIG). Embora este cenrio tenha promovido a difuso do uso de MDE, sobretudo de dados SRTM, a qualidade destes procedimentos prescinde ainda de elaboraes especficas para o atendimento apropriado a estudos do meio fsico. O objetivo geral da proposta desenvolver dados e metodologias para otimizar a utilizao de MDE para o diagnstico de estados e processos do meio fsico que requeiram fatores topogrficos elaborados. Entre os aspectos-alvo de diagnstico, prope-se o aprofundamento da caracterizao topogrfica do substrato (solos e rochas), seus desdobramentos ecofisiolgicos na vegetao natural e na agricultura, alm de experimentar buscar aplicaes com a modelagem de processos erosivos e ameaas naturais. As metas estabelecidas incluem a reviso das variveis bsicas, identificao daquelas de importncia potencial e desenvolvimento de recursos para seu clculo e derivao em ampla cobertura; avaliao de contribuio dos subprodutos SRTM aos dados RADAM; avaliao e desenvolvimento de mtricas do relevo para inferncias sobre substrato; mapeamento de variveis-chave para modelagem de processos de eroso e de ameaas naturais a partir de MDE e promoo de ensino e difuso do uso de informaes derivadas de MDE em aplicaes correntes. Os dados SRTM, sobretudos da banda C (SRTM-C), e seus subprodutos constituiro os insumos prioritrios, embora se considere tambm o uso de GDEM, SRTM-X e MDE originados de curvas de nvel. Entre os resultados esperados listam-se dados elaborados para aplicaes de ampla ocorrncia e metodologias para derivao de informaes de aplicaes especficas a diferentes estudos do meio fsico..
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Modelagem digital do terreno aplicado a estudos do meio fsico

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PRODUTO-TECNOLOGICO.TITULO-DO-PRODUTO: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height models for a portion of the Black Hills Experimental Forest in 2002 ( http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0002)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:The data product contains 1 meter raster data sets for three different digital elevation models (DEM) for a portion of the Black Hills Experimental Forest in South Dakota in 2002. The first is a digital terrain model (DTM), which is the ground surface with all vegetation and human-made structures removed. The second is a digital surface model (DSM), which includes all vegetation and human-made structures. The last is a canopy height model (CHM), which is the difference between the DSM and the DTM surfaces.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PRODUTO-TECNOLOGICO.TITULO-DO-PRODUTO: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height models for the Bannock Creek unit of Boise Basin Experimental Forest in 2007 (http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0003)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The data product contains 1 meter raster data sets for three different digital elevation models (DEM) for the Bannock Creek unit of the Boise Basin Experimental Forest in south central Idaho in November 2007. The first is a digital terrain model (DTM), which is the ground surface with all vegetation and human-made structures removed. The second is a digital surface model (DSM), which includes all vegetation and human-made structures. The last is a canopy height model (CHM), which is the difference between the DSM and the DTM surfaces.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PRODUTO-TECNOLOGICO.TITULO-DO-PRODUTO: Digital surface, terrain, and canopy height models for Priest River Experimental Forest in 2002 (http://dx.doi.org/10.2737/RDS-2013-0001)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:The data product contains 1 meter raster data sets for three different digital elevation models (DEM) for the Priest River Experimental Forest in north Idaho in 2002. The first is a digital terrain model (DTM), which is the ground surface with all vegetation and human-made structures removed. The second is a digital surface model (DSM), which includes all vegetation and human-made structures. The last is a canopy height model (CHM), which is the difference between the DSM and the DTM surfaces.
